Beverley Callard was reunited with her on-screen husband Charlie Lawson today as she celebrated her 60th birthday on Loose Women. 
The Coronation Street star, who has played landlady Liz McDonald since 1989, received a surprise visit from her co-star as the panel donned party hats and gave her a tiara. 
Husband Jon McEwan also joined the fun, while Corrie sons Simon Gregson (Steve) and Nicholas Cochrane (Andy) sent heartfelt video messages to their TV mum. 
Charlie, famous for playing the legendary Jim McDonald, appeared in the studio with a massive Rovers Return cake, complete with a mini Liz standing outside. Read More Charlie and Bev reunited on the show (Photo: ITV) Bev didn't know that celebrations were planned (Photo: ITV) 
Bev spoke about her anxiety at reaching 60, but revealed she is still teaching fitness classes twice a week, as she received champagne from Joe Swash in a bow tie. 
She said: "I loved turning 40 and then 50 but this hit me with a shock. I forgot I was going to be 60. 
"When I woke up on my birthday I was really emotional. It’s that feeling of knowing you’re more than half way, I’m not going to live to be 120. Read More The Rovers Return cake had a mini Liz (Photo: ITV) The Loose Women panel were ready to celebrate (Photo: ITV) 
"I just kept crying all day but happy tears, not sad tears. It was just a weird feeling." 
The Corrie legend had a party with close family and friends, where her 84-year-old mother-in-law Crystal downed jaeger bombs. 
Bev also talked about her battle with clinical depression and said she had Bipolar II, which causes her "massive lows" with non of the highs. Charlie spoke about his admiration for Bev (Photo: ITV) Liz McDonald faces Jim McDonald and orders him to call off the dogs and leave Peter alone, for Ken and Deirdres sake. (Photo: ITV) 
"I have to sort of monitor myself but once you've got well, you know how to do that. I think the most important message is that anyone can get well with the help," she added. 
"The hardest thing to do is to say I just have to stop now. For someone like me that's hard because I'm a workaholic. 
"I think if you’re a naturally strong person it can hit you harder." Like us on Facebook
